data: On a certain evening of July, in the year of grace 1804, old John Burnikel sat in his own chair—that with arms and a high back—his own chair in his own place during the summer—not his winter place—on the terrace outside the Long Room of the Red Lion Tavern.
July | Red Lion Tavern | Long Room
terrace | Long Room | Red Lion Tavern

On a certain evening of July, in the year of grace 1804, old John Burnikel sat in his own chair--that with arms and a high back--his own chair in his own place during the summer--not his winter place--on the terrace outside the Long Room of the Red Lion Tavern.
